newsitem.title: GERMANY: Tietmeyer says sees no creative accounting by Bonn.
newsitem.headline: Tietmeyer says sees no creative accounting by Bonn.

text.p: Bundesbank president Hans Tietmeyer said on Thursday that there were no signs the Bonn government was resorting to creative accounting methods to reach entry goals for Europe's planned currency union.
At a news conference Tietmeyer said he had not seen signs of creative accounting being used in Bonn and added "I wish that were the case in all European Union nations."
Germany has in the past been a very vocal opponent of certain one-off measures that could help nations meet the strict budget target of three percent of gross domestic product.
Both France and Italy have introduced certain measures to help trim their budget deficits.
